g.text: Do Not Cite, Quote or Distribute
The science on climate change, its impacts and the opportunities to mitigate is continuously being
no longer made “in a sea of uncertainty”

lived capital stock or urban forms

estimate that even if the current pipeline of power plants

implying that additional capital accumulation would lead to higher sunk costs

hedging strategies and processes to adjust decisions as new information
becomes available. The notion of hedging against risks is also prominent in the adaptation literature, as
ified by the terminology of “climate resilient development”
(WGII, Ch.18). There is also a growing literature on hedging strategies for individual actors (e.g., firms
